Honestly, this is really just a ride. I would call this game more of an interactive storybook in the future rather than a game. But, this review will only be on the singleplayer, as I have not done the entirety of the multiplayer as of now. But, onto the rankings.
Worth the money: 9.5/10
Difficulty: 8/10
Gameplay: 8.5/10
Story: 9.5/10
Now, onto the review.
This is a very realistic game for the time it came out. And just the atmosphere is so amazing that it really scares me. Now I will say if you aren't playing with an actual 2 button mouse, you will want to. It is meant for those types and it would be so much easier for you. I will say however, that this game is insanely difficult. Maybe its just me, but I sucked at these puzzles. Now its not that the gameplay is bad, no, its the opposite actually. Its just that the puzzles really made you think outside of the box.
Now the story. Holy crap the story. It is really insane how much they can make you feel good or bad about robots. Its amazing how they could make the characters so simplistic yet so deep. Now, I will keep this spoiler free even though this game has been out for over a decade. You'll have to play it to understand the feelings that everyone got from playing this.
This is jam packed with content. As i said, there is also a multiplayer, and even though I haven't gotten all the way through yet, it still is really fun to mess around in there with friends.
I'm no expert. I'm not even close. However I will say that this game is amazing and i can't wait to see if Valve actually does count to 3 this time.

Overall, even if you haven't fully played Portal 1, Recomended. (But seriously you should play portal 1 before this otherwise you would miss some jokes)
